articles.title: Etienne Bacher
articles.contents:
Etienne Bacher
      
      
      
      
      
      Blog
      Projects

      ☰
      
      
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Etienne Bacher
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        GitHub

            I am a French PhD student in the Doctoral Team Unit ACROSS at LISER, Luxembourg. I study the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes and political preferences.
            Besides working on this topic, I also enjoy programming with R by creating Shiny apps or packages that you can find on my GitHub repo. I also write blog articles about R from time to time, that you can find in the “Blog” tab above.
            If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by email, or via Twitter (though I’m not very active on it).
            
            
            
             Interests 
            Economics
            International migration
            Political attitudes
            R programming
            
            
             Education 
            
            PhD student in Economics of Migration, 2020 - current, LISER
            
            
            Master’s degree in Development Economics, 2018 - 2020, University Clermont-Auvergne
            
            
            Bachelor’s degree in Development Economics, 2017 - 2018, University Clermont-Auvergne

    Website created with the distill package.

Projects





tinyslider


Adaptation into R of the Javascript library tiny-slider.js. This package creates carousels in interactive environments, such as R Shiny.

See more





docsifier


Use this package to build a webpage for your package/project documentation. It is the adaptation of docsify.js.

See more





prompter


This package allows to easily add tooltips to HTML elements in R Shiny applications. It uses hint.css under the hood.

See more





circletyper


Curve text elements in R Shiny applications, using Circletype.js.

See more
